nodes.bodyText:
In java doc comments the @returns specify what it returns not the type of return value, the type of the return value is alredy in the function signature.
In this instance it's something like module exists in the project
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -35,15 +35,15 @@
      * Returns true if the module exists in the project.
      *
      * @param moduleId Module Id
-     * @return
+     * @return boolean

@@ -35,15 +35,15 @@
      * Returns true if the module exists in the project.
      *
      * @param moduleId Module Id
-     * @return
+     * @return boolean

nodes.bodyText: This doesn't looks like a cause for java doc issue. Do you have the log for this?

Yes, The ./gradlew :ballerina-parser:createJavadoc command produces the following warnings


/path/to/repo/ballerina-lang/compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/AbstractParserErrorHandler.java:468: warning - Tag @link: reference not found: Action#KEEP


/path/to/repo/ballerina-lang/compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/AbstractParserErrorHandler.java:424: warning - Tag @link: reference not found: Action


and
> Task :ballerina-parser:createJavadoc FAILED
FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.
Any suggestions to be used as the access modifier of the enum Action?
